meanings.definition: A wastrel is a person who wastes their time, money, or resources.
meanings.sent1: The wastrels in the park spent all day lounging around.
meanings.sent2: The town was tired of the wastrels who never contributed anything.
meanings.sent3: The wastrels at the party only cared about themselves.
meanings.sent4: She saw her reflection and realized she had become a wastrel of her own time.
meanings.sent5: The wastrels in the story always learned their lesson in the end.

meanings.definition: Wastrels can refer to a group of people who are wasteful or irresponsible.
meanings.sent1: The wastrels in the office always left the lights on.
meanings.sent2: The wastrels in the neighborhood never recycled their trash.
meanings.sent3: The wastrels at the picnic ate all the food without sharing.
meanings.sent4: The wastrels of society were slowly draining the community's resources.
meanings.sent5: The wastrels in the movie were portrayed as selfish and careless.

meanings.definition: To wastrel means to squander or misuse resources.
meanings.sent1: She would wastrel her allowance on unnecessary toys.
meanings.sent2: He tended to wastrel his time on video games instead of studying.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to wastrel their energy running around the park.
meanings.sent4: The company could not afford to wastrel any more supplies.
meanings.sent5: It pained her to see him wastrel his talent on trivial pursuits.
